title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations. $$-7x+6y=-10$$ $$x-6y=22$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. y will be eliminated and then solve for x. $$-6x=12$$ $$x=-2$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$x=-2$$ into the first equation, $$-7x+6y=-10$$. Then solve for y. $$-7x+6y=-10$$ $$-7\left(-2\right)+6y=-10$$ $$14+6y=-10$$ $$6y=-24$$ $$y=-4$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (-2,-4).
